meanings.definition: Stubborn refusal to obey rules or follow instructions.
meanings.sent1: Her recalcitrancy towards the teacher's instructions led to detention.
meanings.sent2: The employee's recalcitrancy to attend the mandatory training caused issues.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed recalcitrancy when asked to come inside during the rain.
meanings.sent4: His recalcitrancy was like a wall that no one could break through.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrancy of the old oak tree to be pruned made it stand out in the garden.

meanings.definition: Unwillingness to cooperate or be compliant.
meanings.sent1: The child's recalcitrancy to share toys with others upset the parents.
meanings.sent2: His recalcitrancy in group projects often caused delays.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's recalcitrancy to learn new tricks made training sessions challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her recalcitrancy was a shield against unwanted requests.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrancy of the old computer to turn on frustrated the user.
